abstract: The Danish services company ISS is considering a $2.4 billion initial public offering, the proceeds of which would be used to reduce debt.
snippet: The Danish services company ISS is considering a $2.4 billion initial public offering, the proceeds of which would be used to reduce debt.
lead_paragraph: ISS, the Danish services company owned by private equity, said on Thursday that it was considering a $2.4 billion initial public offering, the proceeds of which would be used to reduce debt.

headline.main: ISS of Denmark Moves Toward $2.4 Billion I.P.O.
